content: cap sleeved dress for calico critter and sylvanian mothers by dawn smith the dress is knitted flat on two needles until after it is joined in the round in row 12 it is knitted from the top down you will need - set of four size 0 or size 1 us double-pointed needles - fingering-weight yarn needle size depends on the thickness of your yarn - a small crochet hook for the button loop only - a small button abbreviations k- knit p - purl kfb - knit into front and back of next stitch to increase by 1 k2tog - knit 2 together to decrease by 1 w&t - wrap and turn - slip one stitch as to purl bring the yarn forward between the needles slip the stitch from the right needle back to the left needle turn techniques long tail cast on knit front and back increase knitting on cast on knit two together decrease wrap and turn short row tutorials for some of the above techniques https //knotions com/issues/april 2018/tutorial-april-2018/tutorial-short-row-garter-stitch/ - this tutorial has photos if you haven t done a wrap and turn on garter stitch before https //www youtube com/watch time_continue=4&v=8wupqdytoy0 - video showing long tail cast on method https //www youtube com/watch time_continue=121&v=hs1l_zandhy - video showing knitting on cast on method continental version https //www youtube com/watch v=3bivutz3j4k - video showing knitting on cast on method english version ---- pattern starts here ---- using size 0 or size 1 needles and fingering yarn cast on 27 stitches with the long tail cast on method the tail should measure at least 20 as you begin this will give you enough left for the button loop if you haven t tried this method it s worth the effort once i learned it it became my favorite cast on row 1 knit row 2 k5 kfb 4 times k9 kfb 4 times k5 35 sts ++++++++++++++++++ row 3 k2 p to last two stitches k2 at this point mine measures right at 3 5 across row 4 k5 k1 k2tog 3 times k1 w&t k5 w&t bobble 5 k9 includes the one on the needle repeat between once k5 includes the one on the needle 5-9-5 on needles total 19 sts row 5 k2 p3 turn and cast on one using knitting on cast on p9 repeat between s p3 k2 total 21 sts you can use a different cast on here but this one gives a nice neat underarm row 6 knit across row 7 k2 kfb repeat to last stitch 28 sts this produces a purl bump row at the waist if you want a smooth waist repeat row 3 here instead and do this increase row on row 8 row 8 knit across row 9 k2 p to last two stitches k2 row 10 k3 kfb repeat to last stitch 35 sts row 11 k2 p to last two stitches k2 row 12 divide onto 3 dpns as follows first needle -
